title: Elk River High School
text:
Elk River High School (variously as Elk River Senior High School) is a public high school located in <a href="Elk%20River%2C%20Minnesota">Elk River</a>, <a href="Minnesota">Minnesota</a>, United States. It is the one of four high schools in the <a href="Elk%20River%20Area%20School%20District">Elk River Area School District</a> (ISD 728) and its feeder schools are VandenBerge Middle School and Salk Middle School. In the 201112 school year, Elk River had an enrollment of 1,649 students. Elk River's colors are red and white. The <a href="National%20Center%20of%20Education%20Statistics">National Center of Education Statistics</a> classifies the high school as a large, suburban campus. The Elk River Elks compete in the <a href="Northwest%20Suburban%20Conference">Northwest Suburban Conference</a> of the <a href="Minnesota%20State%20High%20School%20League">Minnesota State High School League</a> as well as in Section 6AAAAA (5A) for <a href="American%20football">football</a>. Elk River High School opened in 1888.
Demographics.
During the 201112 school year, Elk River High School was 90% White, 6% Hispanic, 0% Hawaii Native/Pacific Islander, 6% Black, 7% Asian, and 1% Native American. 14% of students were eligible for the Free Lunch Program and 6% were eligible for the Reduced-Price Lunch Program.
Athletics.
The boys' hockey team has appeared in the <a href="High%20school%20boys%20ice%20hockey%20in%20Minnesota">state tournament</a> in 1993, 1999, 2001, 2002, 2004, 2005. They won the state championship in 2001. Both the boys' and girls' hockey teams play home games on an <a href="Ice%20hockey%20rink%23International">Olympic-sized ice sheet</a> in Elk River Arena, which is located next to the high school.
Media Coverage.
In 2010, four athletes were removed from the highschool's varsity football team under allegations of hazing using broomsticks.
